thread.title: ‘Friction in Science Fiction’ costume party celebrates physics
thread.title_full: ‘Friction in Science Fiction’ costume party celebrates physics

author: Kaitlin Lee
title: ‘Friction in Science Fiction’ costume party celebrates physics
text:
Posted Oct 13, 2015 8:05 am MDT 
Dust off that Starship Enterprise uniform. 
The Rothney Astrophysical Observatory is holding a costume party Saturday, celebrating all things Sci- Fi. 
The event, featuring readings from the Imaginative Fiction Writers Association of Calgary, will highlight the physics in science fiction. 
Visitors are encouraged to come in costume, and check out the large array of telescopes on hand. 
The event is $20 per car, or $10 per person, and runs from 7:30 to 11 p.m. 
All proceeds go to educational program at the observatory. Join the conversation Sign in to comment (not connected to your Insider Club login). You're logged in as Loading profile...
